intro: Cynanchum pingshanicum, commonly known as the Pingshan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and slender, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in mountainous regions. It has a milky sap that can cause skin irritation, which is a common trait among plants in its family. Cynanchum pingshanicum is often used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
